pageContext.claim: “Same thing with Minneapolis. Minneapolis was a disaster. After five or six days, they were going to lose that whole city. We sent in the National Guard. They took care of things in about one hour.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump falsely suggests he had something to do with the decision to send the National Guard into Minneapolis. Gov. Tim Walz, a Democrat, had already directed hundreds of guard members to assemble. Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey officially requested troops on May 28. Then Walz — not President Trump — activated the entire 15,000 member Minnesota National Guard. President Trump just watched the scene unfold on television, and called Gov. Walz, offering to send in military.
